"Stop Circuit Laundry" campaign launched on campus

By Gracie Daw

The campaign has over 500 signatures from students and demands that the University of York end their contract with Circuit Laundry

By James Clay

York academics and students respond to pay cut for staff participating in marking boycott

By James Clay

By James Clay

Lib Dems and Labour battle it out to take overall majority control of the City of York Council.

Labour gain control of the council after winning local elections

By James Clay

A disappointing night for the Lib Dems and Greens in York as Labour reach a majority of council seats

University announces death of Long Boi

By Gracie Daw

The University released a statement on the Radio 1 Breakfast show saying they were "forced to conclude he has passed away"

University announces death of Long Boi

By Gracie Daw

The University released a statement on the Radio 1 Breakfast show saying they were "forced to conclude he has passed away"

James JCRC results announced

James College JCRC results have been announced with Laura Watson being elected as the 2012 Chair

Vanbrugh JCRC elections announced

The Vanbrugh JCRC 2012 team was announced at their Volume event on Friday night with Matt Stephenson winning the position of Chair

University outlines plans to plug funding gap of PS4-PS6m

The University is expecting to face an annual funding gap of PS4-PS6million soon after 2012/13 as departments are told to save space and contain costs (Thumbnail credit The Heslington East campus was funded by a "free cash generation" but uncertain times bring many challenges Image credit: robbophotos)

Postgraduate communities need addressing according to report

A recent study of postgraduate communities at York has highlighted problems with the way in which students and colleges are structured, prohibiting postgraduate students from mixing successfully. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: York GSA)

Disputes continue in Goodricke elections with voting closed

Goodricke's JCRC elections have been overshadowed by a dispute regarding the bans given out for illegal campaigning to election candidates (Thumbnail credit Students from Goodricke used the YUSU bar Courtyard to conduct their hustings after voting had opened Image credit: spanaut)

Application figures for overseas students fall

UCAS application figures show that York is doing significantly better than the national average with only a 1.6 per cent fall in overall applicants from this time last year (Thumbnail credit UK application figures to York have remained stable despite the introduction of the highest level of tuition fees)

Students warned against contacting "unscrupulous" agency

A local letting agency formally known as 'F.L.A.T.S' has recreated itself under the trading name 'Student Housing Services' amid concerns over its "unscrupulous" nature in the past.

Langwith College

By James Bithell

Heslington Road and off-campus accommodation targeted by thieves

The Heslington Road area has been affected by a series of burglaries in recent weeks. Second and third-year students living in rented accommodation have been affected by an increase in crime in Heslington and Fishergate. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Lucy Dixon)

Campaigners march again for better lighting around campus

Students marched for the 'Reclaim the Night' campaign last week, calling for better lighting around campus (Thumbnail credit The University and Council are continuing their dispute over lighting Image credit: Agatha Torrance)

Colleges bid for further funding

Colleges have started bidding to receive a portion of the Vice-Chancellor Initiative Fund. Vanbrugh, Goodricke, and Halifax have all put forward ideas for using the money. (Thumbnail credit Halifax College)

People and Planet campaign for ethical university banking

The People and Planet society is appealing to the University to cut ties with HSBC bank, after it emerged the company is a major contributor of Canada's campaign to continue using tar sands fuel, against European penalties

Third College announced on Heslington East

The University has opened public contract bidding for a PS100 million two-building project on Heslington East campus, one building of which will provide 600 to 650 students accommodation

Contractors leaving housing problems untouched

Students in Halifax and Derwent continue to face problems with the standard of their accommodation as University contractors fail to deliver repairs on time (Thumbnail credit Students have been dissatisfied with the length of time repairs are taking Image credit: Philippta Grafton)

Vanbrugh hosts 'Winter Wonderland'

Vanbrugh Paradise hosted the RAG event 'Winter Wonderland' over the weekend. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Agatha Torrance)

CLASP buildings in need of "urgent" renovation

University Estates and Management have indicated that the Physics and Biology buildings, acknowledged in a recent University Estates Strategy Review, to be in "urgent need of attention", will not be renovated until 2016 at the earliest (Thumbnail credit Over 40% of the University's capital assests need to be refurbished or replaced in the immediate future Image credit: ElvertBarnes)

University sees improvement in its employability rankings

York has risen 24 places in the Sunday Times league table for employability this year, as both the University Senior Management and YUSU stress their increased focus on an area York has performed traditionally poorly in (Thumbnail credit Graduate prospects have traditionally been York's weakness in rankings Image credit: Fijian Scion)

Langwith JCRC Hustings

Langwith JCRC Hustings took place on Tuesday evening at the Courtyard, The buzzing atmosphere of the crowd coupled with audience participation during the speeches made for a lively evening with great college spirit

College Chair Review

By James Bithell

Rose Troup-Buchanan takes a look at whether the College Chairs have fulfilled their election promises

Goodricke JCRC election results announced

The Goodricke JCRC announced their new team for 2012 this week

PS2m to be spent on improving the student experience

The University has released a PS2m package of measures it hopes will improve the student experience at York, as tuition fees rise to PS9,000 from next year (Thumbnail credit Image credit: CARLOS62)

Severed cable causes widespread power failure

Students across campus were without internet and electricity on Monday afternoon. The power went off at 14.20 and was restored at 17.00. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Ally Carmichael. Derwent was one of many colleges to be hit by the power cut)

Goodricke JCRC Hustings

The Goodricke JCRC Hustings took place this week, with three candidates running for the position of Chair

Derwent elects new JCRC team

The Derwent JCRC elections were announced on Friday night in Derwent Bar, with Francesca Knight winning the position of Chair

Academic Officer says fight against fees "is over for now"

YUSU's Academic Officer has said that the campaign against the increase in tuition fee levels is "over for now" with the application process halfway through for those applying for 2012/13 (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Monika Ciapala)

Derwent JCRC Hustings

Derwent College held its 2011 JCRC Hustings event in D-bar on Tuesday night, voting closes on Friday

Vanbrugh Chair debate

The Vanbrugh JCRC Chair candidates gathered in V-bar on Monday night at a debate hosted by URY

Cricket Club criticised over "offensive" email

York University Cricket Club has come under severe criticism following the circulation of a number of highly offensive emails, containing elements of homophobia and sexism.

YUSU LGBT Officer resigns over Union treatment

Emma Brownbill has resigned from her post as YUSU LGBT Officer with three months of her term in office still remaining, there will now be a by-election held in the coming weeks

York Departments win national awards

The University has won two awards for its egineering research and the work of the Archaeology Department
